block.p: Re ''Urban Menace Stalks Street in Diapers,'' by John Tierney (Big City column, June 24):

Granted, Mr. Tierney and his friends ought to be able to have a fine meal in peace, but the unnatural separation and institutionalization of human beings at every stage of development, in places like day care, creates unpleasant children who become unpleasant adults.
Re ''Urban Menace Stalks Street in Diapers,'' by John Tierney (Big City column, June 24):

Granted, Mr. Tierney and his friends ought to be able to have a fine meal in peace, but the unnatural separation and institutionalization of human beings at every stage of development, in places like day care, creates unpleasant children who become unpleasant adults.
Only a culture that sees children as just another acquisition can talk about them as if they were a bunch of noisy boom boxes valued only for the dollars they might contribute to Social Security.
Children who are loved by their families, integrated into appropriate social lives and embraced by community culture are a joy and benefit to all.
